definitions.definition: a person who has been forced to leave their country or home, because there is a war or for political, religious or social reasons

examples.text: There has been a steady flow of refugees from the war zone.

wordOrigin: late 17th cent.: from French réfugié ‘gone in search of refuge’, past participle of (se) réfugier, from refuge, from Latin refugium, from Latin re- ‘back’ + fugere ‘flee’.
